knowledge.heading: Dignity Transcends Social Class
knowledge.description: The text reveals that true dignity and moral worth exist independently of economic circumstances or social position. Characters like the Cunninghams demonstrate honor through their actions and principles, while others with higher status lack basic decency.
knowledge.pattern_connection: Scout's innocent observations allow readers to see moral truth clearly while she remains unaware of the deeper social implications, creating powerful recognition of authentic human worth.

device_examples.quote: One morning Jem and I found a load of stovewood in the back yard
device_examples.effect: The stovewood symbolizes dignity and self-respect that Scout observes without fully understanding its moral significance.

device_examples.quote: Little Chuck Little was another member of the population who didn't know where his next meal was coming from, but he was a born gentleman
device_examples.effect: Contradicts social expectations by showing that poverty cannot diminish genuine character and moral breeding.
